intro: Appendicula maquilingensis, commonly known as the Maquiling appendicula, is a rare flowering plant endemic to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its delicate, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. The plant is often found growing in moist, shaded habitats such as montane forests. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its stems are slender and often hairy. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
